text:
No queue on a Sunday evening. Decided to try a plate of $6 satay beehoon.
Quiet unexpected with the taste and quality. Sauce is very sweet. I noticed the staff owner added lots of sugar while stirring the pot of sauce. The liver and cockle wasn't fresh. Will give a miss. Noticed very low number of reviews.
One of the best I had! The satay sauce gravy was amazing! The ingredients was very fresh too! The meat, cockles, veg and everything was so good! Ordered the $12 biggest plate and no regrets!

One of our favourite satay bee hoon in town.

The sauce is a thick, sweet, nutty aroma that wafts through the air and pulls you in — that's the smell of heaven if you ask us. The sauce here is rich and grainy with larger peanut chunks, and the mild spiciness of it all cuts through its thickness well, making it a perfectly balanced option we go back for time and time again.

Bear in mind that it is not a vegetarian dish. As the peanut sauce has shrimp in it (blended into the sauce, hence it is inseparable)

They sell sauce packaging separately as well. You can bring home and follow the simple 3 step instructions.
Had satay bee hoon ($6) for dinner on 26/4/23, was very good. Their satay sauce is not thick and oily type, easy on the palate.

Date of visit: Sat 13 July 2024
Time : 9 pm

Second visit here. Last time didn’t post !
Satay sauce is good.
Meat is tough though.
